Dear Amy Harding:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12503 Policy and procedures
Section (2) The policies and procedures shall cover at least all of the
Description following areas:
(b) Types of living arrangements provided or approved.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency is not following Independent Living policies and youth's IL
contract by not providing youth with their own bedrooms.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on June 23, 2023,
and advised he did not have any additional information to add.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed via Teams on June 23,
2023. CA stated youth in Independent Living (IL) have their own
assigned rooms.
Deputy Director (DD) for Independent Living Plus was interviewed
via Teams on June 23, 2023. She stated that both youths are still
residing in the ILP house at this time. She stated there has never
been any sign that Youth A and Youth B were staying in
bedrooms other than their assigned rooms. A room search was
completed on Youth A’s bedroom and there was no indication that
any of Youth B’s belongings were in there. Staff also checked
Youth B’s bedroom and there was no indication that Youth A
belongings were in there. Youth B was moved back into her
assigned bedroom on the 2nd floor of the ILP house. She had
temporarily moved into a vacant bedroom on 1st floor while waiting
for a window air conditioning unit to be installed in her bedroom.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the agency on June 26,
2023. She stated all youth have their own room. Youth B stated
she sleeps alone in her room and is not aware of any youth
sleeping in bedrooms other than their assigned room.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on June 29, 2023. Youth A
stated all youth in the IL home have their own designated
bedrooms. She stated there are no circumstances when youth
stay in other bedrooms for extended periods of time but
acknowledged on occasion one or more youth may go into
another bedroom to watch a movie and have fallen asleep.
2

Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on June 26, 2023.
The independent living house has bedrooms for youth on the first
floor and a few on the 2nd floor. Bedroom space for Youth A and
Youth B were viewed. Both bedrooms had one twin bed and a
dresser. There was not any indication that Youth A and Youth B
are staying in the same bedroom.
Documents reviewed:
• IL program description states the staff supported housing is
a communal type of living arrangement. Youth have their
own room.
• IL Plus lease agreement states youth rent their own
bedroom.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on completed
interviews, tour of the IL Plus house, and review of IL Plus
documentation the youth in the IL Plus house all have their own
bedrooms and there is no indication that the youth are sharing
bedroom space.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff did not provide adequate supervision of IL youth as youth
were drinking alcohol in the home with staff present.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on June 23, 2023,
and advised he did not have any additional information to add.
CA stated the agency is going to be terminating the staff who was
present during the night of the incident. CA stated he was sitting in
the office almost the entire shift and wasn’t monitoring the
cameras and didn’t follow up on the activities that were taking
place.
Deputy Director (DD) for Independent Living Plus was interviewed
via Teams on June 23, 2023. DD stated there was an incident
where alcohol was obtained and consumed in the ILP house. DD
stated while reviewing video surveillance footage she could only
verify Staff 1 leaving the office to check on the youth on two
3

occasions. In addition, DD learned that Staff 1 left after his shift
despite no staff reporting for third shift. DD stated he never
notified anyone that the third shift staff had not shown up. She
stated a staff member did arrive approximately 35 minutes after
Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the agency on June 26,
2023. Youth B stated all the staff at the agency supervise the
youth. When specifically asked about Staff 1, Youth B stated that
he monitors the camera and walks around the agency when
needed.
Youth A was interviewed via telephone on June 29, 2023. Youth A
stated Staff 1 checked on the youth during his shift on June 16,
2023, approximately every 20 minutes or so. She stated he was
not aware there was alcohol on the property. She stated there has
never been a time where Staff 1 or another other staff were not
adequately supervising the youth.
Staff 1 was unable to be interviewed. Three attempts were made
via telephone to contact him, however he did not answer or return
the calls. As of June 23, 2023, Staff 1 is no longer employed with
the agency.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of June 16, 2023, Corcoran Independent Living
house.
Video was reviewed during second shift (2pm-11pm). The agency
has an extensive surveillance camera system that has
approximately 20+ cameras. Beginning at approximately 7:30pm,
there is a lot of movement by all of the youth. Two youth leave and
come back at approximately 8:30pm. Upon their return the
majority of the youth go into a bedroom and are in there until
approximately 9:30pm when they go outside to an area with a
couple picnic tables. The picnic tables are not within view of the
outside surveillance cameras. Staff 1 is viewed to be in the office
monitoring the camera system. He leaves the office at 8:30pm and
walks around but does not check on the bedroom the youth went
in or the outdoor area. During the shift Staff 1 is viewed to leave
the office area on three occasions but does not check the area
where the majority of the youth are. He leaves the building at
approximately 11:15pm. At that time, the youth come inside. Third
shift staff member is viewed entering the IL house at
approximately 12:05am and conducts bedroom checks.
Documents reviewed:
4

• 2nd shift responsibilities include walking through the building
to ensure no safety concerns are present, engage with
youth, conduct room checks, and confirm youth are
present.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance as there is video
documentation that shows Staff 1did not complete a sufficient
number of walk throughs during his shift on June 16, 2022. As a
result, youth brought alcohol into the home and consumed it for
several hours to the point of intoxication. In addition, Staff 1 left
the IL Plus house after his shift and did not notify anyone that the
3rd shift staff did not arrive as scheduled to relieve him.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan no change be
made to the license status of this child placing agency.
